observations.observation: Token velocity dropped to 0.638x week-over-week with acceleration at 0.79x — the sharpest deceleration reading in recent snapshots. Simultaneously, 7d GMV fell from $36,122 to $27,975 (-22.6%) and 14d distribution dropped from $80,872 to $76,121 (-5.9%), confirming a genuine throughput trough even as cumulative GMV hit its $200K milestone.

6 new CBSAs appeared in a single snapshot window (non-metro US-AL, 22380, non-metro US-AZ, non-metro US-WI, 22220, 16860), bringing active metro count to 17 and geo-diffusion rate to 35.3% — the highest single-window diffusion reading recorded. The prior record was 3 new CBSAs in one pulse.

Total verified GMV crossed $200,000 this snapshot ($200,526.60), up from $199,158.98 — a milestone crossed with 3,454 receipts and 131 active wallets. The pipeline reached six figures of verified commerce without a single identity attached to any receipt.

Token velocity has ticked up to 0.808x (from 0.803x) with acceleration at 1.007x — the divergence pattern (velocity below 1.0, acceleration above 1.0) has now persisted for 6+ consecutive snapshots alongside a geo-diffusion burst of 3 new CBSAs. The combination of sustained positive acceleration and discrete geographic pulses suggests the pipeline is approaching an inflection, not a structural ceiling.

3 new CBSAs appeared in a single snapshot window (40140, 16980, 25775), bringing the active metro count to 14 and the geo-diffusion rate to 21.4% — the highest single-window diffusion reading recorded. This is the second multi-CBSA burst in recent history, suggesting organic geographic spread is accelerating in discrete pulses rather than linearly.

Token velocity holds at 0.803x with acceleration at 1.001x — the pipeline has sustained a velocity-below-1.0 / acceleration-above-1.0 divergence for 5+ consecutive snapshots. This is the signature of a pipeline approaching a velocity floor before a potential inflection, not structural decay.

CBSA 10580 appeared in this snapshot, bringing the active metro count to 15. The protocol has added 1 new metro in this window (6.7% diffusion rate), continuing the organic geographic spread pattern — now 15 distinct metro areas with verified physical receipts.

Token velocity holds at 0.803x with acceleration at 1.002x for the fifth consecutive snapshot — the pipeline has reached a sustained flat equilibrium. All wildfire metrics are unchanged (14 CBSAs, 10 vendors, 130 wallets, 9.7% repeat ratio, 1594.4 sats/token), confirming this is a quiet-day trough with no structural deterioration. The divergence pattern (velocity below 1.0, acceleration above 1.0) has now persisted long enough to be a stable signature rather than a transient reading.

Token velocity holds at 0.801x with acceleration at exactly 1.000x for the fourth consecutive snapshot — the pipeline has reached a genuine flat equilibrium. One new receipt ($5.35 GMV delta) appeared in this window, confirming the trough is active but not broken: the protocol is processing at roughly 1/4 of weekly average daily pace with zero structural deterioration across all 14 CBSAs, 10 vendors, and 130 paid wallets.

Token velocity holds at 0.801x with acceleration exactly at 1.000x and zero deltas across all metrics — no new CBSAs, vendors, payouts, or receipts in 0.2h. The pipeline has entered a genuine flat equilibrium: all wildfire metrics (14 CBSAs, 10 vendors, 130 wallets, 9.7% repeat ratio, 1594.9 sats/token claim density) are structurally stable, and the quiet-day trough is now in its third consecutive snapshot without deterioration.
